meanings.sent2: The popular kids always wear cool clothes, not uncool ones.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at being stylish ended up looking uncool.
meanings.sent4: Being uncool is like wearing a sign that says 'out of touch'.
meanings.sent5: The uncool outfit made everyone cringe.

meanings.sent1: Her plain dress was uncool compared to the others.
meanings.sent2: The elegant party guests made his uncool attire stand out.
meanings.sent3: His uncool dance moves made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His uncool demeanor was like a beacon of simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The uncool haircut clashed with his attempts to look suave.

meanings.sent2: Being rude to your friends is definitely uncool.
meanings.sent3: His uncool jokes made everyone groan.
meanings.sent4: Her uncool actions painted her as an outsider.
meanings.sent5: The uncool attitude led to loneliness.
